channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Traffic lights not working, 21st January
item.description:
The traffic lights on the junction of Southwark Street and Southwark Bridge Road are constantly breaking down. This is a very busy road and it is unacceptable that these lights do not work as if makes it very dangerous for anybody trying to cross, especially children and disabled people who may need extra time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 59 1/2, Southwark Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 10 priory Park Road to 42 Priory Park Road, 21st January
item.description:
A lot of litter down the street to be picked up, please

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Priory Park Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Street cleaning - Grass verges / Shrub beds - Littering

item.title: Uneven pavement, 21st January
item.description:
The pavement on Southwark Bridge Road (outside the petrol station) is dangerously uneven with one side markedly higher than another. There are also loose tiles on the floor that are a trip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 101-103, Southwark Bridge Road, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nearby crossing fixed, but could this be inspected now please?, 21st January
item.description:
This fix was made for the nearby crossing at the end of Widmore. Could this one please be inspected and fixed now please? It is coming loose.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33 - 34, Market Square, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Golf club building becoming dilapidated, 21st January
item.description:
Ruxley golf club building is suffering from damp and neglect - paint peeling - why is the building being left to get into this state ? Is it your responsibility or Mytime's ?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandy Lane, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Could this graffiti be removed please?, 21st January
item.description:
If this could be removed please it would be appreciated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glassmill Lane, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumped and public bin is overflowing., 21st January
item.description:
The public bin by the bus stop SD (89, 486 going to Welling), is overflowing and there are another 2 white bags dumped there.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shooters Hill, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is litter on the planters on Tabard Street, 20th January
item.description:
There is plastic bottles, food packaging, paper and christmas tree dumped at the planters on Tabard Street. It has been there for three days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pilgrimage Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A MESS - Bikes in road causing obstruction and in residents parking bay - please remove, 20th January
item.description:
A MESS - Bikes in road causing obstruction and in residents parking bay - please remove

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ainger Road, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car left for 2 weeks and blocking traffic, 20th January
item.description:
This car has not moved for 2 weeks and has caused problems to the traffic by inconsiderate parking as shown in the pics. It has not been parked properly and it is inconvenient for road users. Please can this vehicle be checked and removed where necessary.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Farm Road, Mottingham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Exposed wires, 20th January
item.description:
The door of this lighting column is damaged. One corner of the door has been peeled back allowing people access to the wires or for further damage to be done which would allow the entire wire set up to be exposed. There is also a chance of water getting inside and damaging the circuits.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): King's Cross, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Street Light - Equipment damaged, pole leaning

item.title: Dog mess in playground, 20th January
item.description:
Lots of dog mess in Mint Street park on the sides of paths that has not been cleaned up. I think some more signs are needed to remind dog owners to clean up their dog’s mess. It’s very unsightly but also dangerous near the children’s playground where a lot of toddlers use the facilities.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37-48, Marshalsea Road, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole related to roadwork near the pavement of queenstown road, 20th January
item.description:
This is not my usual road, some road work beside the pavement cutting the cycling route with uneven surface and a pothole that is dangerous for Brompton bikes due to their wheel small size.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 374, Queenstown Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken bottles, 20th January
item.description:
The location of this problem has already been reported here with various bags of rubbish being dumped, but now on a daily basis there is broken bottles with lots of glass littering the pathway of the pavement from the alleyway between Springfield Gardens/Springfield Road and Fairmead Close. This area seems to being used as a dumping ground. There is a disguarded christmas tree complete with a pot, a baby's bouncing chair. It has frequently had problems of this kind but recently it is getting out of hand and dangerous to walk through and the area is used often with children going to and from school.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fairmead Close, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 20th January
item.description:
The bins on Mint Street are always overflowing and there are always a lot of things left there without being taken for weeks. I walk past this place every week day on the way to my son’s school and find it unhygienic and unsanitary.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mint Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 82 st margarets terrace, 20th January
item.description:
Fly tipped items amongst overflowing bins. School just nearby. Unacceptable

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Margarets Terrace, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped bed near bins, 20th January
item.description:
Obstruction to pavement along with the ridiculous amounts of black bins. There is a nursery just along from here. Terrible for the kids to see and the push chairs to get through.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Vernham Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes and uneven surfaces around estate, 20th January
item.description:
There are several potholes around Peabody Estate in Southwark Street, my husband is disabled and has tripped more than once due to the uneven surfaces. These holes have been here for the last 3 years without being fixed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76-80, Southwark Street, Southwark, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 164 burrage road, 20th January
item.description:
This hmo has various articles fly tipped in the front yard and onto pavement. Overflowing bins. Absolutely eyes sore and health hazard. There are six residences in this terraced house. Its outrageous.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Vernham Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins obstructing pavements, 20th January
item.description:
There are two green bins unnumbered left in the way of the pavement opposite a tree causing obstruction. Can't get wheelchair or pushchair through. Added to this various bins from no 20 vernham road being left here every bin day should be left on vernham road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Vernham Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet
